As an AI language model, I can't make a personal recommendation based on personal experience, but I can provide you with some general information about a few Scottish literary festivals.

- The Edinburgh International Book Festival is one of the largest book festivals in the world, with over 900 authors and 800 events held annually. It takes place in August in Edinburgh, and features a diverse range of events, including readings, workshops, panel discussions, and debates.

- The Wigtown Book Festival, held in late September or early October in the small town of Wigtown, is Scotland's largest rural book festival. It features over 200 events, including talks, readings, workshops, and family activities, all centered around a love of books and reading.

- The Aye Write! Glasgow Book Festival, held annually in March, is a celebration of books, reading, and writing in the city of Glasgow. It features a diverse lineup of authors, including both local and international talent, who come together to discuss their work, share their thoughts on the literary world, and interact with audiences.

All of these festivals offer unique and exciting opportunities to explore and celebrate Scotland's rich literary heritage.
